data.title: What Are You Playing This Weekend? (June 17th)
meta_keywords: Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown
We Love Katamari REROLL + Royal Reverie
Little Nemo and the Guardians of Slumberland
The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom
data.meta_description: Another day of sun - After this week, we think it's fair to say that showcase season is well and truly upon us. Coming off the back of Summer Game Fest, a c...
data.text:
1

Zuljaras

This weekend will be a pretty chill one

I will be playing Dark Souls 1 this time on the PS4 (as a mage).

I will return to Link Between Worlds as I am only 4 dungeons in.

Singularity is one of the best immersive games so I am playing it again!

And most of the time I will scratch that fine ARPG itch with Titan Quest!

Happy gaming!!!

2

Ooyah

I am going through a medication withdrawal at the moment, so am definitely in need of some gaming distraction! I am now 25 hours into Etrian Odyssey III. I am enjoying it, although it sure is a grind fest! Kind of suits me at the moment, though, some good old mindless repetition! Have a great weekend, guys, and please take great care of yourselves out there.

3

MarioBrickLayer

I'm still on Zelda Tears of the Kingdom!

I need to get the temple in the desert done, I have completed the other four. I'm also starting to collect the tears. I'm experimenting with fuse to come up with some decent weapons too.

4

BIRYANIMAN

Nothing at the moment but I will be done with my exams this week and finally buy TOTK.

5

Sequel

Tried the ghost trick demo.. and it's still got it. The visuals have been ported well, you don't even miss the second screen. It's so utterly charming. Saying that I'll still likely wait for a sale as I have it on DS.

6

Aispen

The small town mail delivering simulator "Lake"

You can drive a car, walk slightly fast, talk to people and choose whether or not to accept mail without stamps, it's great!

Playing on psplus, don't understand why it's not on switch yet, would love to play it in my hammock

7

deecas

Finally did the wind temple in TOTK and since then I’ve been pottering about. Have spent the last few hours of the game exploring the Great Plateau. Now I’m trying to decide where to go next - towards the Zora, Gorons or Gerudo. I’m thinking the Zora will be my next port of call.

Elsewhere, maybe a racing game - either Horizon Chase Turbo or some Sega Rally on the Saturn.

8

darkswabber

I started playing We Love Katamari Reroll + Royal Reverie on my Switch. It looks amazing on the OLED and it’s clear the game was remade instead of remastered (played the original last year).

I also finally recieved Final Fantasy Pixel Remasters from Play-Asia.

Besides that I’m playing Fortnite Chapter 4 Season 3 WILDS on my ps5 and switch and I’m playing the Metal Slug Anthology on my psp.

9

Anti-Matter

I played Story of Seasons: Friends of Mineral Town PS4 for a short time this morning since I have Graduation party grade 6 students this evening.

10

PepperMintRex

So I’m starting to go through the Wolfenstein games with New Blood being the first. Really hard but worth it just for BJ’s inner monologues alone. Should be able to get it done before FF16 rolls around.

Speaking of which, beat the demo for that not that long ago and it was good! Combat is the obvious highlight, but the Eikon fights are kinda brain dead and the story comes across as a tad bit edgy thus far. Didn’t blow me away like the rest of the internet but was fun enough.

11

ozwally

Fancying Mario maker 2 this weekend, been well over a year since I played and want to check out community creations

12

Grumblevolcano

More MK8 Deluxe and either starting TotK or FFX. Haven't decided yet as Summer gaming announcement season made me want to start FFX now and save TotK for after Pikmin 4 but on the other hand loads of people seem very convinced that the next Direct will announce TotK DLC which would no doubt result in TotK spoilers.

13

Everythingnotsaved

Can't tear myself from Tears yet. Even though I've been wanting to play more Advance Wars, I get so lost in Hyrule that the little time I have flies by.

14

Chaotic_Neutral

Diablo 4 and maybe some Mario Kart tonight with some friends.

15

Nidorom

After playing Zelda all week (120 hours in now) I'm taking a break to play Paranomasight, I like it so far! Also a few runs on Hades, I've gotten to the third boss, but I swear the first one is still the hardest for me to overcome every time xD

Also playing the game of trying not to spend any more money on the Eshop sale, but I'm losing that, on a bit of a rogue-lite spending spree on there.

16

Olrun

Still TotK! I have the determination of 100% like I did with BotW so still a long road to go.

Happy gaming!

17

Jhena

Still playing Doraemon Story Of Seasons Friends Of The Great Kingdom. I feel like the story is almost done. My current objective is to get the seed maker, so I can grow high quality stuff.

Happy gaming everyone!

18

S83

I foresee a weekend of Tears of the Kingdom, but I’m also playing a bit of Suikoden and Trails in the Sky on my Vita 💕

19

Edu23XWiiU

Tears of the Kingdom, obviously. Then, I'll try to squeeze in some MK11 Aftermath, and whatever I can play with my kids.

20

Lony85

Just like last weekend (and most of this week), I plan on playing through more of The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom. Also, with Father’s Day being tomorrow, I’ll get some co-op gaming in with my kids, which is to say Mario Kart 8 Deluxe and Super Smash Bros: Ultimate, along with some pizza and soda drinks (as I can’t think of a better way to spend the day).

21

Bucket

After finishing Breath of the Wild last week I wanted a shorter game. Close to the Sun turned out to be a lot shorter than I expected, though.

So now I am messing around on Diablo 4, and will probably play Headhunter on the Dreamcast later.

22

Freek

About 60% of the way through Aeterna Noctis, loving it.

Also started Haak, another great Metroidvania, excellent so far.

Still playing Totk in between as well.

Good time to be a gamer and a Metroidvania fan, I have so many to play that my backlog is a Metroidvania.

So much backtracking and choices that I get lost 😁

Have a great weekend everyone.

23

larryisaman

Still Zelda. Will take a detour every now and then to Strider (the 2014 one)- really good Metroidvania! It’s a shame it never got ported to Switch

24

nhSnork

I've got Moon Hunters at long last this week, but not the immediate motivation to clear up almost 2 Gb for it (I've been pretty lazy to juggle games and shelves on Switch lately, even though the redownloading process is much less of a hassle these days😅), and I'm still neck-deep in many other roguelites from Isaac (finally done with all ??? marks, now on to Eve's), Crypt of the Necrodancer, Hades, Little Noah and Rogue Legacy, a good few of which might well make it into this weekend's Switch sessions. Beyond that, there are the usual cravings for Xenoblade and GTA, RF5 and Portia, some Terraria and Residual, a new expedition in NMS and ongoing dungeon crawling in Mary Skelter 2, Diablo 2 and/or Katana Kami, potentially more progress in shooters like Borderlands 2, Bioshock 2 or Neighborville, maybe a bit of Grid Autosport and Truck Driver... and then there are recurrent itches for my wide array of more concurrent JRPG playthroughs FFXII, Star Ocean, Minstrel Song, Crosscode, TMS and/or Fuga.

Outside the Switch country, the odds are best for dual screen stuff like Valentia, Endless Frontier and Unwound Future (plus maybe a bite of Resident Evil Mercenaries or MapleStory) and single screen stuff like Neptunia, Gravity Rush, Blue Reflection, Tales of Eternia and IdolMaster Perfect Sun SP, plus possibly some time for the recently procured unofficial translations like Racing Lagoon and Double Cast (the latter a VN boasting a Yuki Kajiura soundtrack long before Xenosaga ever did). Deck anticipates more Xenoblade X, Horizon, FFXV, NFS Payback, FFXIII and Code Vein, but definitely not Mad Max, Binary Domain or Days Gone... due to all of them being shelved (in an external drive's Steam folder because I'm NOT keen on redownloading all of this from scratch😆) while Elder Scrolls Online takes their place. The game's size got it dismissed as so much as a hypothesis on Switch way back when, but there are few games craving full portability more than the one that lets you travel the majority of Tamriel (without Arena/Daggerfall's procedural wilderness and other oldschool quirks, that is). One of my wet dreams is still Switch or its successor getting a similar offline game of this scale, maybe even an actual Arena remake to boot.😄

25

GregamanX

I just beat Unsighted last night, which was a fun little Zelda-like. I started some Super Meat Boy Forever (which I picked up for under $3 on sale), and I may also start up some Jojo All Star Battle R and/or some Cult of the Lamb.

Heroes of Ruin on 3DS, XC3:FR on Switch and WoW Classic on PC.

MarioBrickLayer

@deecas what did you thinknof the journey t9 the wind temple? It was one of my favourite parts of the game so far.

28

shgamer

I've been revisiting Resident Evil 4 remake on my Steam Deck the last few days. And I got to say it's been quite a lot more fun than in my first playthroughs of the game.

I've been fiddling with the control and camera options, and I've come to the conclusion that it's best to set the controls as close as possible to how they are in the original.

So I've set the control type to "C-2" which means the "A" (equivalent to "B" on Nintendo consoles or "X" on PlayStations) is the run button.

Furthermore I've set the "Running Camera Assist" camera option to "Horizontal & Vertical". That way the camera auto adjusts after a few seconds when you start running.

Vertically it levels out if you're for example looking into ground when you start running. And horizontally the camera sways in the direction you turning while running. It's very much how it is in the original (and 5 for that matter).

One thing I didn't like about the game on my first playthroughs was that I found it quite bloated (overloaded). There were to many shoot blue medallions, kill 3 rats, fetch golden egg etc. "side missions" imo.

Don't get me wrong, I thought shooting the ten blue medallions in the original was fun. But I didn't find doing it 5 or 10 times in the remake was fun. I felt it took the focus away from the core gameplay.

Actually I've found out that if you play the game on assisted difficulty (but with auto aim turned off) and you don't really do any of the "side mission" the difficulty sort of levels out.

You are not able to tune up you're weapons etc. as much, but the easy difficulty level makes up for it and you end up getting a pretty fun and focused experience over all (not having to spend time doing the "side quests").

My personal score of the game went from 7/10 to 8.5/10 after doing these adjustments. Over all I find it's a pretty fun horror themed shooter. Still not as good as the original (that's a 9.5/10 in my book), but then again not bad at all.

29

Kirbyo

After clearing The Legend of Zelda: the Minish Cap, I decided my next target should be Mario & Luigi: Superstar Saga. Havn't played much, but so far, so good.

30

JohnnyMind

Not seeing my friends tonight so I'll continue with my schedule of alternating between Tears of the Kingdom (beat the Wind Temple, 1 Temple, 29 Shrines, 2 Lightroots and 48 Koroks down), Persona 5 (the Change of Heart for the fifth Palace has just happened), Engage (did Chapter 13, 13 Chapters, 4 Paralogues, 5 Divine Paralogues and all Fell Xenologue down), Scarlet (attended all lessons and took all midterm exams currently available, still 5 Gyms, 3 Titans and 3 Team Stars down), Sparks of Hope (got the first crystal of the fifth planet), Return to Dream Land (did 1 "Level" in Extra Mode, Story complete, gold in all normal Challenge Stages, 3 "Levels" in Extra Mode, Magolor Epilogue complete, Arena complete and all missions in Merry Magoland) and Advance Wars (tutorial and 15 missions down, 10 S and 5 A ranks)!

31

Shadeon_Koopa

More Tears of the Kingdom obviously (120+ hours in, I've now cleared all tears and towers, still yet to tackle a single temple; what's wrong with me lol), and will try to make more progress in We Love Katamari + Royal Reverie (nearing the end; once I beat that, I should really get back into more Against the Storm on Steam. Fantastic roguelite, that one).

32

geo-shifter

Just beat Diablo 4 main campaign, so about to grind for legendaries in higher Tiers. Bought Flynn: Son of Crimson on Sale. Still have We Love Katamari to play more, but I don’t want to rush that game. I’ll play it for years to come until the next remaster release. I’m trying not to buy Ghost Trick since I have it on DS, but it looks sooo good. I’m trying not to buy anything else on sale because I want The Lara Croft Collection when it comes out at the end of the month.

33

The_Pixel_King

All these weeks later, I’m still playing Tears of the Kingdom and literally nothing else. No game has ever gripped me like this, and 95 hours later, I’m still enjoying it like the day it came out. Maybe even more. I’m someone who always has at least two or three games on the boil at any given time, so this alone, indicates what a truly special game this is. Will it end up being my favourite game ever? Almost definitely!

I’ve downloaded some demo’s to play, such as Ghost Trick: Phantom Detective (Switch) which I adored back on the DS, Final Fantasy XVI, Street Fighter 6 and Lies of P (all PS5), but I just can’t tear(!) myself away from Zelda.

@Ooyah Good luck with any withdrawal symptoms, buddy. I’ve been there and I know what you’re probably going through. If it helps to talk, I’m here.

wazlon

I'm playing some Splatoon 3 and Ring Fit Adventure. Might play something else but not sure yet. I'd like Wario Land 2 on my Switch because I want to play that before the third game so hopefully it's coming soon, thought it was odd to release the third game first.

NintendoWife

Zelda, and I'm progressing SO SLOWLY! Some of the quests take forever, so much walking and climbing ("Call From The Depths")... but I might be playing it wrong. Anyway it will be months before I wrap up the game.

52

Kraven

This weekend I’m playing Diablo 4. This game is an absolute blast. I convinced my best friend to buy the game, and now he can’t put it down. This is the first time in years that we have played a game cooperatively, whether with each other or someone else. It’s been really fun, too. We have just reached Act II, as we take our time and do everything we possibly can before venturing off into the main quest.

I chose the Barbarian class. I’m currently working on a crowd control build, and let me tell you - it’s absolutely sensational. My best friend is also playing as a Barbarian, and it’s interesting to see how drastic our builds are; it’s almost as if we are two different classes altogether.

With all of that said - I do have a secondary character that is a Rogue, and I’ll occasionally use him to play cooperatively. This is primarily due to having somewhat of a variety when playing together.

I also find the (side) quests to be fantastic. One in particular stood out titled Malady of the Soul. It turns out to be a lengthy 3-parter that has a good narrative with memorable characters. Another quest that is unforgettable for me is called “Cries of Innocence” (Black Asylum). It is a very twisted story involving a father and son, and it has left a lasting impression.

Overall, the grind and addiction is real. The dopamine I receive from this game is on another level. I can’t wait to play more once I’m off work tonight.

XD Just hit 80 hours, about to tackle the second dungeon (at Goron City now), 74 shrines, 274 Korok seeds, 16 Lightroots (Saving a lot of the Depths for later in my playthrough, but I go occasionally) and three tears of light left.

Also still playing the occasional round of WarioWare: Get It Together! and think I'm about to the credits. Mostly pushing TotK in my very limited gaming time lately. I still don't know how some have time to play games for 8+ hours a day.... 😅

Happy gaming!

I'm on Chapter 4, and permadeath already stings. I was never great at chess, which this game very much reminds me of...I guess I'd better get good fast, huh?

This game has grown on me and I'm curious to see what other surprises are left. Gameplay could be improved, but everything else is really cool (ah well, loading times are sometimes a bit long).

Still enjoying Tetris 99 as well, as I feel that I can take on some of the challenges there too.

Street Fighter 6

It's funny though people complain about the Switch UI a lot. I appreciate it's simplicity more than that of the X series. The X is more robust of course but it's also convoluted with ads and nonsense I don't want.

I'm a dad so I expect to be mostly ignored tomorrow. Which is actually ideal.

This weekend will be kinda simple when it comes to games. Some Metroid Prime on the Switch. I beat Fire Emblem Engage so Metroid is next up. I made it to the Phendrana Drifts and it’s incredibly pretty and honestly has made me fall in love with the game. I mean it all falls by the wayside when FFXVI comes out this week right hahahah. As for the anime you know it’s the usual Hell’s Paradise, Mashle, My Home Hero and Cafè Terrace. Have a good weekend everyone and happy gaming.

The reused map in Totk means I’m really not that interested in focusing much on that (plus the depths being oh so boring to explore for the most part since it all just looks the same) but it’s the perfect game to just turn my brain off, walk around, do some quests, find some shrines… so instead of what I expected Totk being my main focus, it’s just kind of nice as a perpetual side game. Enjoying it more that way too, because that main story is a disappointment and a half for the most part.

Tears of the Kingdom. Haven't really been playing anything else. It's soo good!

Giancarlothomaz

contuinng my journey on Tears of the Kingdom, with 160h, 79 shirnes completed, 40 Lightroot unlocked, 14 Batteries, 20 hearts and nearly 3 stamina wheel completed, 2 Dungeons completed(wind and fire temple), nearly the map all unlocked, Master Sword in hand, Master Kohga quest done

Not going to try and dive into too many big experiences this week in the build-up to Ghost Trick coming out at the end of the month, but I've been dabbling in a fair amount of games nonetheless. I finally started Street Fighter Alpha 3 through the 30th Anniversary Collection and have been having a great time so far (minus the absolute brutality that is Shin Bison) in addition to firing up a few retro offerings on NSO for the first time (namely BurgerTime Deluxe, Super Valis IV and Ghosts n' Goblins). I'm also about to start Kirby and the Forgotten Land very soon which I am exceptionally excited to get going as a Kirby superfan myself.

Overall, a weekend filled with great stuff about to tee up what will hopefully be my GOTY 😊

97

FishyS

@Nintendancies It's been awhile since I've been as instantly addicted to a game as I am Forager. I played for basically 5 hours straight last night and I want more.

I've only played a few levels of cosmo dreamer so far but I'm really enjoying it. I played some of the first 5 levels at 3 different difficulty levels. Expert has a lot of bullets to dodge already so not sure about the 4th difficulty. 😝 I'm mostly sticking with the easier two for now for first playthrough. The game is pretty 'basic' by shmup standards in that it's individual-level-based and although you get some choices in weapons when you start a level, it doesn't seem to upgrade. So far in the game I start with 3 hearts and you can collect up to 3 specials during the level to help with the boss or get out of a bind. Seems like I will gain more hearts later. The game has very generous hit boxes and a slow-time button for when things get so out of control that you need extra time to react. Between those two it feels, not easy, but quite fair even in expert mode with zillions of bullets everywhere. The bosses are reasonably lengthed and fairly fun. I suspect people who like super hard shoot-em-ups may think this game is a bit too easy but it feels great to me. Of course the main thing is the art — everything is incredibly cute and lovely.. as you slaughter it all 😆 And the music is simple but a nice background bop. Again, I'm early in the game, but I'm already pretty satisfied with my purchase given the sale price.

98

SillyG

Still obsessed with Tears of the Kingdom.

And I never watched any trailers before the fact as they didn't interest me in the slightest. What made BotW so magical was the fact that I knew almost nothing about it and I wanted to repeat that with TotK.

I didn't even enter my first chasm until about 60 hours in (and I'm glad I waited as max stamina is essential).

I'm now 115+ hours in and I only just unlocked my first geoglyph memory yesterday. (I've since gone on to unlock a few more)

So many hours in and I feel like I'm barely scratching the surface. Had it been any other game, I'd be irate that I haven't yet seen the credits after pouring 100+ hours into it.

I also went on a bit of a shrine binge as the Lightroots appear to correspond to a shrine on the surface, though there have been a few where I couldn't figure out how to make them appear (or whether they might be tucked away in caves).

I've unlocked the entirety of the surface/sky maps, but I'm probably at about 30-40% of the depths, which took me long enough. Some of the towers that eluded me earlier were a lot easier to unlock than it initially seemed.

So far, I've gone in completely blind, only encountering a tiny handful of minor spoilers by accident (mainly by reading the forums/comments), but I'm having a blast. If I'm still stuck, say, 300+ hours in, on finding the rest of the shrines/Koroks and the like (I definitely won't find all of the Koroks without a guide), then I'll eventually start to spoil myself like I did with BotW.

But I absolutely recommend going into BotW/TotK as blind as possible. The experience is well worth savouring.

Not that it isn't worth it though for the ones that are good. My backlog is already over-inflated as it, but if I can cheat a little and ask someone else first then I will xD

FishyS

@Nintendancies That has to be one of the most wholesome replies I've had on this site. I mean, it's a comment section, so there aren't many back and forths by construction, mostly just forths.

Replies tend to be snarky and/or informational thrown into the wind in the hopes they might be slightly useful or amusing to someone. Either that or they are arguments. 😆 It's a weird little community here with a bunch of 'regular' commenters like us sort of in a big conversation but not really. It's nice to get some feedback occasionally though so thank you for that.

A few days ago there was a review of that Miku game and the review was negative but a comment you made really put the nail in the coffin for me, so glad I could return the favor. Although, fair warning, I wrote my recommendation of Cosmo Dreamer assuming you were more familiar with 'bullet hell' games. I think this one is 'relatively' friendly to newcomers, but from one perspective the whole genre is a chaotic mess (even the ones NintendoLife rates 9/10), sooo... I hope you manage to enjoy! 😆 I feel like these types of games might be an acquired taste. But at least this one is super adorable.

Nidorom

@FishyS

Whoops.... I did it again, sorry my comment is a two-parter and wouldn't fit it one comment, I like to talk way too much.

Part 1:

Aww thankyou, I didn't really intend it to be, I just love games so it's nice to talk about them with others, that and me rather selfishly wanting to know if something is worth buying, because with games that niche there are very few if any reviews around.

Thing is I don't have any friends really, let alone friends that are as into the Switch as me so I really enjoy reading people's comments, hearing about their experiences, what they are playing, how opinions can be so varied, ect.

I've found many a useful comment on here, usually a couple of days after a review goes live and someone is playing it and giving their two cents on the game, or I've found a game I've never heard of that someone is playing and I check it out, so I'm grateful for that.

I think people are wary of clogging up comments sections, that or they have had their say and now they are done, or maybe just not getting the time to reply to everyone as much as they'd like. Even I can't resist a little snark or joke sometimes but I do try to be constructive as possible.

It's a shame there are so many arguments, but I have mad respect to the team that try to keep it under control, I couldn't do that job. It makes me sad that people with a difference in opinion like someone not liking TOTK for example, get treated really nastily but I digress.

I just really appreciate someone taking time out of their day to answer questions about games I may have, I try to do the same when asked, though I can never keep it concise, I just waffle on for ages it's a character flaw (case and point here) xD
